intro: Phaeocarpus, commonly known as the "false sandalwood," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plants are characterized by their simple, opposite leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. Phaeocarpus species are often found in moist, shaded habitats, and some are used in traditional medicine. The fruits are typically small, dry capsules that contain several seeds.
